summary: This document appears to be a financial statement or disclosure from J.P. Morgan, detailing procedures for reporting errors or questions regarding account transactions. It outlines the responsibilities of the account holder and the bank in case of discrepancies, as well as information about margin accounts and securities transactions.
locations: Three Chase Metrotech Center, Brooklyn, NY 11245-001
keyFacts: The document provides instructions for reporting errors on financial statements within 60 days.
It mentions that J.P. Morgan will investigate complaints and correct errors promptly.
The document outlines the handling of margin accounts and the use of securities for short sales.
It specifies that free credit balances in margin accounts are not segregated and may be used in the operation of J.P. Morgan Clearing Corp's business.
The document includes references to various regulations and the legal framework governing transactions.
